3.m: And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins and clothed them. - Genesis 3:21 (ESV)

l.q: Why did the man and the woman disobey the LORD God?
l.a: The man and the woman disobeyed the Lord God because they believed what the serpent said - that they will not die and they will be wise like God.

l.q: How did the man and the woman's disobedience affect their relationship with God?
l.a: The man and the woman became afraid of God. They realized that they have sinned before God and were ashamed of their nakedness. Because they sinned, they were separated from God who is Holy.

l.q: What were the consequences of the man's and woman's disobedience to God?
l.a: The man and the woman will experience pain and suffering. They and their children will never be able to go back to the Garden of Eden. They will have to live in an imperfect world and work for their food and survival.

3.p: Lord God, you alone can discern our thoughts and the motives of our hearts, and there is nothing that we can hide from you. I pray that you will continue to work in me and grant me discernment that I may recognize and not give in to temptations and disobey you. Please protect me from the evil one and surround me with people who are right with you and help in times of weakness. May I always be reminded of your word and may I turn to you instead when I experience temptations.
